bill_title: rescind previous applications of the State of South Dakota for the calling of a federal constitutional convention to amend the Constitution of the United States.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to rescind previous applications of the State of South Dakota for the calling of a federal constitutional convention to amend the Constitution of the United States. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The Legislature finds that it is not, at the present time, desirable to apply for a federal constitutional convention to amend the Constitution of the United States. Section 2. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The specific provisions of the following joint resolutions, all making applications for the calling of a federal constitutional convention, are hereby repudiated and rescinded: (1) HJR 2, 1907 Legislative Session; (2) HJR 7, 1909 Legislative Session; (3) HJR 5, 1909 Legislative Session; and (4) HJR 503, 1971 Legislative Session. The repudiation and rescission provided for in this Act is strictly limited to the portions of said resolutions making application for the calling of a federal constitutional convention and do not apply to the alternative call embodied in the joint resolutions for Congress to propose specific constitutional amendments to the states for adoption.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
